name: Smart Contract
definition: Self-executing code on blockchain with predefined conditions. Runs automatically when conditions are met without intermediaries.

name: Wallet
definition: Software or hardware that stores cryptocurrency private/public key pairs. Used to send, receive, and manage digital assets.

name: Blockchain
definition: Distributed ledger technology that records transactions in chronological blocks linked by cryptographic hashes. Immutable and decentralized.

name: Mining
definition: Process of validating transactions and adding new blocks to blockchain. Miners are rewarded with cryptocurrency for computational work.

name: Gas Fee
definition: Cost required to execute transactions or smart contracts on blockchain networks like Ethereum. Measured in gwei or wei.

name: DeFi
definition: Decentralized Finance. Financial services built on blockchain without traditional intermediaries like banks or brokers.

name: NFT
definition: Non-Fungible Token. Unique digital asset representing ownership of items like art, collectibles, or virtual real estate on blockchain.

name: Consensus Mechanism
definition: Algorithm that validates transactions and secures blockchain. Common types: Proof of Work (PoW) and Proof of Stake (PoS).

name: Private Key
definition: Secret cryptographic key that authorizes cryptocurrency transactions. Never shareâ€”loss means permanent loss of funds.

name: Public Key
definition: Publicly shareable cryptographic key derived from private key. Used to receive funds and verify transactions.

name: Staking
definition: Process of locking cryptocurrency in a wallet to support blockchain operations. Rewards participants with additional tokens.

name: Nodes
definition: Computers that maintain copies of the blockchain and validate transactions. Essential infrastructure for decentralized networks.

name: Token
definition: Digital asset built on existing blockchain (e.g., ERC-20 on Ethereum). Can represent ownership, utility, or governance rights.

name: Airdrop
definition: Free distribution of cryptocurrency tokens to wallet holders. Marketing strategy to increase adoption and awareness.

name: Fork
definition: Change to blockchain protocol creating new version. Hard fork (incompatible) or soft fork (backward compatible).

name: DAO
definition: Decentralized Autonomous Organization. Smart contract-based organization governed by token holders through voting, no central authority.

name: Ledger
definition: Record of all transactions on blockchain. Distributed across network nodes, immutable once recorded.

name: Hash
definition: Cryptographic function converting data into fixed-length string. Used to secure blockchain data and verify transaction integrity.

name: Decentralization
definition: System architecture where control is distributed across network instead of centralized authority. Core principle of blockchain.

name: Altcoin
definition: Any cryptocurrency other than Bitcoin. Alternative coins created after Bitcoin with different features and use cases.
